extendedIngredients.name: onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tbsp black onion seed (kalonji or nigella)

recipes.title: Creamy chicken & mango curry

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Toss the chicken thighs with 1 tspof the turmeric and some salt. Heat theoil in a big frying pan or wide flameproofcasserole, and brown the thighs well onboth sides. Remove from the pan. Addthe chopped onion and cook for 5 minsuntil softened.Roughly cut all the flesh from oneof the mangoes, scraping as much asyou can from the stone. Put into a foodprocessor with the korma paste, ginger and quartered onion. Whizz to a paste,then tip into the pan and gently cookuntil softened.Stir in the remaining turmeric, cuminand onion seeds and turn up the heatfor a couple of mins. Return the chickento the pan. Stir in the coconut milk andstock. Bring to a gentle simmer, thencover and cook for 20 mins.Uncover the pan and cook for another25-30 mins until the chicken is reallytender, adding a few drops of waterto keep it saucy.Slice the remaining mango and stirin to heat through while you shred thechicken with two forks. Season andserve scattered with the coriander,with basmati rice, naan bread, chutney,lime pickle and our sides, if you like.

steps.step: Toss the chicken thighs with 1 tspof the turmeric and some salt.
Heat theoil in a big frying pan or wide flameproofcasserole, and brown the thighs well onboth sides.

Addthe chopped onion and cook for 5 minsuntil softened.Roughly cut all the flesh from oneof the mangoes, scraping as much asyou can from the stone. Put into a foodprocessor with the korma paste, ginger and quartered onion. Whizz to a paste,then tip into the pan and gently cookuntil softened.Stir in the remaining turmeric, cuminand onion seeds and turn up the heatfor a couple of mins. Return the chickento the pan. Stir in the coconut milk andstock. Bring to a gentle simmer, thencover and cook for 20 mins.Uncover the pan and cook for another25-30 mins until the chicken is reallytender, adding a few drops of waterto keep it saucy.Slice the remaining mango and stirin to heat through while you shred thechicken with two forks. Season andserve scattered with the coriander,with basmati rice, naan bread, chutney,lime pickle and our sides, if you like.
